website_summaries.verdict: Individuals searching for a comfy hiking boot that is both lightweight and waterproof may find the KEEN Targhee II Mid as an interesting choice. It also receives appreciation for its comfortable feel and surface traction. However, there are reported cases from consumers about the sole’s quality and how it delaminates after several uses. Overall, the Targhee II Mid may have what it takes to serve day hikers well, as long as KEEN resolves its durability concerns.
pros: The KEEN Targhee II Mid earns a lot of praise from buyers and gear testers alike for being an insanely comfortable hiking boot
Its lightness astonishes a majority of users
Based on a handful of consumer reviews, the Targhee II Mid’s waterproof membrane is effective against the elements
A bunch of adventurers attests that they stayed on top of challenging surfaces, thanks to its grippy outsole
According to a minority of purchasers, this KEEN offering’s break-in period is short
Several outdoorsy individuals find the arch support of this footgear to be sufficient
cons: A considerable percentage of shoppers complain about the KEEN Targhee II Mid’s outsole by saying it comes apart after a few uses
Some outdoor enthusiasts say that it is not breathable
A few wearers state that the boot’s ankle support is lacking

customer_reviews.title: I was very pleased with the first pair
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these boots. I was very pleased with the first pair. The current pair has not done very well at all. I just purchased them in November and it is May (6 months) now and the bottoms are falling apart. I’m trying to get in touch with Keen to see if they will send me a pair of replacement boots. I think that I should get more than six months wear from a premium pair of boots. I would expect a cheap pair of boots from a discount store to wear out this quick but not a $100 + pair of boots. 😡
customer_reviews.author: Mark Perry

customer_reviews.title: A-OK
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a pretty good boot. I have "duck feet" and typically wear size 12 or 13 Wide depending on the manufacturer. As Keen has a wide toe box, I don't usually need to order wide's. I've worn Keen Austin size 13 boot's and shoes for years but needed to order a size 14 in the Targhee. I'd give it a 5 star except in my experience with 2 different Keen non Targhee boots they are not terribly durable and when they fail, it's not telegraphed, they just fall apart and you have to limp to your car ASAP. I find Keen's generally comfortable but do not trust them all that much.
customer_reviews.author: Jonesy3000

customer_reviews.title: I have been very disappointed with my Keen boots
customer_reviews.text: I have been very disappointed with my Keen boots. After 1 week of wearing them they are showing sign of unsticking to the front and the sides. I would like to get reimbursed. Please tell me how to return the shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Moi-Même

customer_reviews.title: 3 failures on 3 pairs
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of Keens in a row that have failed. Two sets of soles had glue failures and came off . On my current pair the shoe laces eyes broke. Keens customer service didn't seem to care and wouldn't help. I have had no other shoe failures during that time. I wouldn't recommend Keen, thier priced like a quality product but built cheaply and don't stand buy thier product.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip

customer_reviews.title: Excellent boots
customer_reviews.text: My husband teaches at a military base after as well 22 years of service in the USAF. He has numerous issues physical wise after his years of service. He is on his feet 12 to 15 hours a day with his students on the range. We have searched and gone through several pairs of boots. He came home yesterday and said these boots get an A on everything. Im very excited to have finally found him something that will help him during in long days in the Florida heat along with being in a physically taxing job. Great pair of boots and well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Momof5

customer_reviews.title: Alright shoe, but not good enough for me.
customer_reviews.text: This Targhee II actually felt better than the Targhee III, which is supposed to be the updated version with more improved features. This outsole is like a wooden plank and there really isn't much inside the boot to give your feet a comfortable ride. I put some nice orthotics inside, but I could still feel a knobby pice of the tread near my instep, that transferred pain to my planter fascia. Couldn't say much good about a brand that I once wore religiously.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Lovelace

customer_reviews.title: Great Boot For Daily Walk in Fields
customer_reviews.text: ***Update*** Like some other reviewers my husband found the waterproofing not up to previous Targhee II he has owned. He submitted a warranty claim online. In just under 3 weeks, Barbie Bell of Keen issued a replacement. Keen is challenged by COVID and the wildfires. He is looking forward to receipt of replacements. My husband loves these boots. Uses them every day, alternating pairs, walking the dogs 2.5 to 3 miles a day, alternating pairs, in 0* winter snow, spring showers, mud, 90* heat, high grass and fall leaves. Just works. Keep them clean, after 3 months spray with nubuck protector to maintain exterior WP. Yet Keen does not make a 10 narrow for Women. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: GBM

customer_reviews.title: Boxy Front Toe
customer_reviews.text: Keen's are a quality hiking boot. Shoes are specific to the wearer, but just like other quality boots, keen uses quality materials, beautiful fit and they work. Last couple pairs had problems with bottom of boot splitting after a year of use, so there has been some slippage in the quality of materials or the method in which they had been applying those materials in the last two years. I usually hike between 50-80 miles a week. Still if you need a bit more roomier hiking boot, without going to a size E, then Keen is a quality product I have used for the last 20 years. They are warrantied for one year.
customer_reviews.author: Malibu Mike

customer_reviews.title: Above Average Boot
customer_reviews.text: This book is comfortable and seems well made in that it doesn't appear to be falling apart after much use. I see others have had problems, I'm not seeing those issues. The only issue I have with this boot over my more expensive boots is that it has one top eyelet. Most good boots have two and that gives them a lot more ankle support and a tighter fit around my ankle. I would recommend these boots. They are not $200 boots, but if you don't have $200, these will do well enough for light hiking. If you plan to hike with a heavy pack, these are not the boots for you. You'll need something with more support.
customer_reviews.author: Marv Conn

customer_reviews.title: size matters
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product in the past, and liked the comfort and quality. I had purchased a pair early this year in size 10.5 US, which is pretty much my standard shoe size. Fit was fine, except the tips of my toes were rubbing on the front of the shoe. I can wear them, but need to limit the type of activity. I did not have this issue with my first experience with the shoe. I decided to purchase the size 11, and while I have room up front, this size feels loose. Will try different socks....but in short, sizes need to be tested for fit.
customer_reviews.author: Ray DePalma

customer_reviews.title: Never again Keens
customer_reviews.text: These are the worst boots I’ve ever worn. I gave them a few weeks and got tired of my feet hurting at the end of the day, so I returned them. They don’t flex at all which is a telltale sign of a poorly made boot and is usually seen in cheaply made ones. With the reputation Keens has and considering their price, I was extremely disappointed. I hope their other boots are better but I’m not wasting my time trying any. I’m going back to Wolverines that I’ve been wearing for close to 20 years that feel broken in when they’re new and I can be on my feet for 8-10 hours a day and my feet feel great.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: This pair fits even better and seems to be slightly re-designed to improve sliding ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair. The previous ones I had lasted over 3 years but I did not wear them daily, mostly weekends, walking dogs, and doing yard work. This pair fits even better and seems to be slightly re-designed to improve sliding them on your feet. Comfortable, not hot, and keeps feet dry. Great boots in summer and winter. The size was exactly what I was expecting. A bigger toe box is what drew me to these boots originally and these still have the same amount of room. Highly recommend for those with duckish shaped feet.
customer_reviews.author: J.B. from Indy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent boots
customer_reviews.text: Just ordered this pair to replace ones from 5+ years ago. I follow remote construction work across the country and normally work on uneven and rough terrain. Excellent ankle support for a mid, definitely waterproof. Personally I need the extended cover over the toebox. Appreciate Keen's quick notch shoelace lock, making them quick to put on. The pair that died had a seam bust out near my big toe and the toe cap finally came loose (glued it back on for a while). Still on original shoelaces.
customer_reviews.author: S Force

customer_reviews.title: My fourth KEEN shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are my fourth KEEN hiking shoes and the the first pair of boots. I ordered the same size I’m always getting and found that the boots are somewhat tighter and the soles harder than the shoes. So far I wore it for two hikes walking for about 15 miles without any complaints, but I had relatively thin socks. I am hoping that it will expand a little so that I can use thicker socks during the coming winter season. The next time I’ll definitely consider a half size larger shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Laszlo from NC

customer_reviews.title: Seems a little big, not so much that its a issue
customer_reviews.text: Got these to use instead of wearing my loggers around the farm all the time. I love my Carolina's but after wearing them year round for 8+ years during the mist of winter and the dead of summer I finally come to the conclusion that I do not want to be wearing them in 90+ degree weather with jeans on this year. Some co-worker wear these and love them, hence why I am getting them, they seem well built and YES thank god they are breathable. They seem a little wide at the toe, but what do I know. I haven't wore sneakers for a long time. Ill update if they start to break down, Ill be using them alot.
customer_reviews.author: Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Tried a couple pairs with the same defect in the left insole.
customer_reviews.text: I had problems with the insole of the left boot. The outside of the insole was raised causing uneven pressure on my foot. No way I could hike in that boot. The right boot did not have the problem so I thought it must be a manufacturing defect. I ordered a replacement and the replacement pair had the same problem. I have bought Keen several times before and have had problems with manufacturing defects but I have never had problems ordering replacements that fit correctly. The color I ordered had a great price so maybe they are trying to dump their defective shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: THE RUBBER SMELLS LIKE SKUNK!
customer_reviews.text: SMELLY!! These are made with cheap rubber soles that smell like they are skunk scented. I have lots of hiking boots and in my 40 years on earth have never had a foot odor problem. These shoes changed that. They stink!! Keen rep said that it was common and would go away within a few weeks. Not only does the smell remain 45 days later but has gotten worse. My other two Merrell boots that I wear 8 hours a day working construction have ZERO smell. I wear these for an hour and get sick from the odor. DONT BUY THESE. (Unless you work in manure. The smell of manure would be an improvement.)
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: On my 4th Pair, No brainer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great waterproof all-around hiking boot. Just bought a 4th pair (over about a dozen years) and the build quality and materials are always the same - durable and lasting. I wear these as everyday shoes in the winter, have a old pair for car-camping, and love them so much. They are breathable, yet waterproof and really hold up well to the elements of Colorado. Don't mess around with the others, Keen has been making this boot to perfection for years.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Allred

customer_reviews.title: CAUTION!!  Two sizes too small!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazon recommended ordering a half size larger than normal. My foot is professionally sized at 13.5 by the Red Wing shoe store staff. I ordered a size 15 boot, just to be safe, as I prepared for an upcoming elk hunt. Right before my departure, I discovered that the 15 was TOO SMALL!! It took a size 16 boot to fit my size 13.5 foot!
customer_reviews.author: ward

customer_reviews.title: First time around disappointed but customer service stepped up
customer_reviews.text: EDITED: My first round of Targhees really let me down, falling apart after less than 4 months. However, customer service finally came through and honored my warranty with another pair. So 1 star for my first pair but 5 stars for customer service. I'll update after giving my new pair a few months in the field.
customer_reviews.author: WayfaringStranger

customer_reviews.title: Not For Me
customer_reviews.text: I like Keen products. I was surprised to find that the stitching in the heel cup for the waterproof membrane was a wide and coarse zig zag stitch. In my experience this leads to severe heel abrasions which are unpleasant at the very least. It has happened to me more than once, even when using a sock liner and midweight wool socks. I immediately returned the boots. I did get another pair of Keen boots without the waterproofing.
customer_reviews.author: Van

customer_reviews.title: No need to break in, comfortable, light and waterproof.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of these, normally people recommend ordering 1/2 size larger, which I did, these were still a little tight, better with thin socks. On this pair the sole started deteriorating in several areas so pieces of the sole would fold over and cause you to trip. That didnt happen with the first two pairs, not sure why it did on this pair. I wore the last two pairs for work, but I’ve retired so this pair hasn’t worked as hard. Will probably try another pair, if they come apart too I probably won’t buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: John B. Robbins

customer_reviews.title: Used to be a great shoe! Not so much anymore :(
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd or 4th pair of Keens I have bought my husband. He raves about their comfort, and he wears them all day at work 10 plus hours a day on his feet! Unfortunately, the last 2 pairs we have purchased have fallen apart within 30 days! The soles start to come loose and the rubber starts to tear off leaving big pieces hanging off. This is a serious danger! You can get the rubber caught on things, they are a huge fall risk. We will not be buying these shoes anymore, and we're totally bummed.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good fitting boot
customer_reviews.text: Just put my new boots on for the 1st time and I can already tell that I am going to be a fan. I usually wear a size 15 wide to get shoes with a wide enough toe box so as not to trigger a gout attack by pushing my big toes in. Since these are waterproof and waterproof shoes usually run small due to the additional internal membrane, I ordered a size larger. Good move on my part. Based on another review, I ordered a standard width rather than wide and they are right on. I'd be swimming in a wide width.
customer_reviews.author: Drake Otis

customer_reviews.title: Go to all-around boot
customer_reviews.text: I wear these hiking in the mountains and daily on my cattle ranch. They are fairly waterproof, breathe well and are comfortable. I have purchased and worn keens for 20 years. The only issue I have had is the sole rubber spalling off but I think Keen has improved their china qa/qc process.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots! I wear them as a dual purpose "winter" and "hiking" boot. They are nice for the Minnesota winter because they keep the water, slush, and snow out. My feet stay dry and warm (although they do tend to sweat a bit more, but that is the nature of boots vs shoes). It took a little while to break them in. I would give them at least 10 hours of hiking/walking before deciding if they are comfortable. One little issue is that the shoelaces come untied. I'll have to see what I can do to solve that...
customer_reviews.author: Ryan J.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable from the get go!
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves these boots. He says there is no break in time, you just put them on, and they’re good to go, very comfortable. His last pair we bought at a high end shoe store, but when the sewing on both sides of the boot near the toe area started coming apart after about 7 months, they wouldn’t stand behind them. Amazon’s price saves about $30 so made it a bit easier to swallow the poor customer service from the other store.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Patterson

customer_reviews.title: The will not work with the suggested Keen insoles sold seperatly
customer_reviews.text: The boot is very nice but they are way to tight when the keen insoles are added.. The construction is superior to Merril but the comfort level is not as good. I will wear them for another month before deciding if i would buy them again. I originally gave this product 4 stars because i liked they looked and the ruggedness of them, but i have to lower it to a 3, they do not break in and get more comfortable, Keen needs to make their boots wider or offer a wide version. I gave them to my son who has narrower feet and even he finds them tight,
customer_reviews.author: Lane

customer_reviews.title: Don"t buy, very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Have hiked a pair of Keens for five years and have probably done over a thousand miles in them. Absolutely love them. The outside is still in great shape but the interior is wearing out. Ordered new ones and was very disappointed. Should have listened to the negative reviews. They were a bit small but that is not the problem. Compared to my old ones they are cheap cheap cheap! They do not compare to the old ones. Think maybe it's better to shop at a retail store for hiking shoes so you know what you are getting. Bob in Virginia
customer_reviews.author: Swimmer

customer_reviews.title: Absolute excellence!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely perfect hiking boots. I've never paid this much for hiking boots, so I can't compare it to the pricier ones, but these are really excellent. Tromped in water and mud that covered the boot and didn't have a single issue inside the boot itself. 14-month update: unfortunately the plastic part inside of the boot that protects the area around the heel broke. These boots were so well-made that the piece could be snapped back in place and be totally wearable. I contacted Keen customer service, and even though the boots were 4 months out of warranty, Keen furnished a full refund. I’m never wearing another company’s boots again.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Fit is GREAT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've always like Keen Boots. Before I retired I use to buy Keen Utility Boots and was always very satisfied. I needed a pair of boots to walk the dog every morning on a wooded trail, I also wanted a water proof boots, a few mud holes along our walk. They arrived a few days ago, the minute I put them on they felt like morning slippers. When through a few water spots this morning and my feet were nice and dry, let's hope the continue to be this functional!!!
customer_reviews.author: NRC

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with Keen!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of keens targhee II. My first pair was bought exactly 13 months ago. This is the best waterproof hiking boots I have ever had! 13 months of everyday use to work (I'm on my feet all day and put on 10+ miles a day running around at work. They are still waterproof to this day! Thank you Keen for making an awesome product!
customer_reviews.author: Nick H.

customer_reviews.title: Like very much
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots. This is my second pair. I own two other brand boots that cost more but don't feel as good. I wear these to walk two miles a day, shovel snow, cut grass or go to the store. This brand breaks in faster than any other I have owned. I wore my Keene's to Paris in 2018 where we walked everywhere. I have never twisted an ankle with this boot which I am prone to do.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality less than 3 months and they’re coming apart.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in these boots!! If you hike 4 days a week do not buy these boots. I have been a Keen footwear customer for the better part of 15 years, in the last couple years I’ve been pretty disappointed in the quality of their products. These boots I’ve had for less than 3 months and they’re already starting coming apart. I’m not sure what’s happening with Keen footwear but the last couple times I’ve purchased their footwear I’ve been disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Ojyllek

customer_reviews.title: Testing in progress but liking them so far.
customer_reviews.text: Just broke them in today with a 7 mile hike. Love my steel toe Keens so had to try their hiking boots. Price was awesome versus local store. Boots fit fine, love the wide toe box. Gave it only 4 stars because after tightening them several times my feet still touched the end of the toe box on down hills. Maybe have to break them in some more to get them to tighten enough around the ankle.
customer_reviews.author: Andres Salinas

customer_reviews.title: Hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: I have over 150 moderate hiking miles on these boots bye far the best boot I have purchased excellent traction in wet muddy conditions highly water proof ankle support for mid ankle ok but lacking and the only other complaint just a bit warm but I'm sure that will change this winter thumbs up 🙂 not showing much wear at this point
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Second Pair that I Have Bought, But...
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. This is the second pair that I have bought. I wear them when working on the farm and I’m pretty hard on them. They are extremely comfortable, but I use orthotic inserts. The first pair held up pretty well, but the soles started coming apart and I couldn’t glue them back. I’d give 5 stars if not for that, but like I said I’m pretty hard on them.
customer_reviews.author: KY Home Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Light. Comfortable.  Waterproof. Buy them.
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pair of keen steel toes for work and were the most comfortable boots I ever bought. I figured I'll try some of their boots for hiking... welp they were great. I'm a big fella and don't hike much but bought these puppies for a weekend AT hike. Did 34 miles in these guys in 2 days and they were so comfortable. I seriously loved these boots. While I don't think they are the most stylish they are soooo comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Good boot. Cleats came loose
customer_reviews.text: Got a year out of them before they started to wear out. Made 4 backpacking trip. 1 was in winter and two were in the rain. My feet stay dry (except for that time I fell in the creek) water gets in its pretty much in there till you can dry them. That’s any waterproof boot. Anything around the ankle is no trouble. I don’t know if I’d buy them again because the bottom came loose. Expected better for the price and rest of the quality of the boots.
customer_reviews.author: East Kentucky Bushwacker

customer_reviews.title: Nearly 6 years old before needing replacement
customer_reviews.text: I was just thinking of buying a new pair of these, since the traction is getting worn down on my current pair. Amazon informs me that I bought the pair I am currently wearing in January of 2012, it is now September 2017. Now I am sure I will get another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Least Most Wanted

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT hiking shoes.  Runs small, order a 1/2 size up.
customer_reviews.text: Changed out the foot pad to the Heavy Duty Dr. Scholls as I have nueropathic pain. This is now my favorite walking/hiking boot I've ever owned. Found out about this brand on Backpacker website and am so glad I upgraded from Columbia brand shoes. Like my title states, I ordered 1/2 size up from my normal 11.5 and they seem to fit perfectly. Good luck & happy hiking!
customer_reviews.author: Nobama

customer_reviews.title: They are sooooo comfortable too. It's now been about 6 months later ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these around October of 2016 for a vacation trip to Disney World. I am not exaggerating when I say that after 5 days rides and walking they still looked brand new! They are sooooo comfortable too. It's now been about 6 months later and I've done some light hiking in them and wear them to work 2-3 days a week. They don't look brand new still but they are far from being retired. I expect to get a few years at least out of them. These are by far the BEST boots I have ever owned. Just buy them! You won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: TechDaddy

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I got a size 9 mens. I would ordinarily take an 8W mens but there were no Ws to be seen (at least when I ordered). They fit fine; the extra length doesn't trouble me. It's a nice looking, reasonably comfortable boot/shoe. Not particularly waterproof, but I knew that when I ordered. It's a little better than my boat shoes. 🤷‍♀️
customer_reviews.author: CindyTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Good looking shoe.  Size up.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this boot in size 14 after trying the Targhee Low II in both regular and wide sizes13M and 13W. Both were too short and too narrow; in fact, the 13W had the exact same width as the 13M. The 14M fits me well, especially with my orthotics, which lift my foot up in the shoe a little bit. I bought a Merrill Moab 2 at the same time in size 13EE for comparison. The Targhee 14M has a wider toe box than the Moab 13EE, but they have the same length and the same width at mid-sole. The Moab is more flexible and has softer side walls. It is going back.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShoppers

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking boot at a mere mortal price!
customer_reviews.text: Great hiking boot at a mere mortal price! Can't think of anything negative. I went totally by previous customer reviews. I did swap inserts right away as many have suggested, as I was already having some impact issues. Very little break in time before a serious (for me) hike. Not a hot spot at all. My feet are a little wide, and this boot showed up in lists for people with wide feet. You know that feeling when you slip on a shoe and it just fits? That was it with this boot. Part of hike I purposefully stepped in puddles to see if I'd get any water in, and sure didn't. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Doctor W

customer_reviews.title: Defective Hiking Boots and Jet Shoes Refused to Replace
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my husband in March of 2018. I had a pair of women's Keens that I love. The soles started to separate on both shoes after 9 months of normal wear. Jet Shoes refused to replace them stating a 30 day refund policy. I will never purchase from Jet Shoes again. I took my case to Keen and Amazon. I will let you know what happens.
customer_reviews.author: Cici Granstedt-Hallberg

customer_reviews.title: Poor sewing and fraying of materials.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I really enjoy these boots. For what you get, the price is right, somewhat. I've read many reviews, and the main complaint was construction. My soles have not loosened, yet, but the stitching has come loose. I have not contacted customer support yet, so this review is subjective at this point. I will update asap.
customer_reviews.author: Adam B.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great comfort and safety
customer_reviews.text: As a Type 1 diabetic, I'm very conscious of the proper fit and comfort in my footwear. This is the second pair of this style of Keen that I have owned. (My first pair lasted close to 5 years) I also own Keen sandals and Keen dress shoes. This boot is well made and looks great!
customer_reviews.author: Paul J. Sorensen

customer_reviews.title: Sized a little small
customer_reviews.text: I had previously purchased a pair of Targhee III hiking boots at an outdoor store. They fit like a glove but were really too nice to wear for every day work boots. So I ordered this pair of Targhee II boots in the same size assuming that the sizing would be the same from the same manufacturer. That turned out to be an incorrect assumption. However, after stretching them with shoe trees for a couple of weeks and wearing them for a couple of months they are only a little snug. They seem to be very well made and look like they will last a long time. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Boots coming apart after a few moths
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my KEENs last fall and have done some light hiking and a fair amount of walking with them since then. They have been fantastic boots and feel very sturdy and comfortable while providing excellent support. Unfortunately, as you can see from the photos I attached, the rubber soles are peeling away from the base of the boot. I'm not sure how much longer they will last before they are flapping with every step. A quick Google search will show that this is a common issue with the boot. Buyer beware
customer_reviews.author: doom

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but don’t last
customer_reviews.text: I am a professional wood worker and bought these to wear working on a concrete floor in my woodshop. I don’t wear them hiking or on rough terrain like a construction site. Just daily use walking on concrete. After just six months the soul is pealing off, has separated from the side, and makes a hissing sound with every step. I expect when I pay good money for shoes to get a good quality shoe, lasting at least a year. While these shoes are super comfortable, they unfortunately are not made to handle daily walking on concrete.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Moose

customer_reviews.title: Great boot, very comfortable and light
customer_reviews.text: A great boot and very comfortable. Bought for my son for trip to Philmont. He loves the fit and marvels that they are fairly light. I hope they withstand the abuse of Mt Phillips. Update: He loved them and said they were excellent. He has a narrow foot and wears size 13. He said they were true to fit and with a liner and wool socks, the fit was spot on.
customer_reviews.author: T. K. Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, great support. Long hikes are a joy. Just keep them dry.
customer_reviews.text: I always go up a half size for my hiking boots and wear good socks. Proper lacing technique is important for rugged terrain. These were surprisingly comfortable right out of the box but I wore them around town for a few days before heading into the woods. Over the course of several trips, I racked up enough mileage on and off the trail to be really impressed. Very comfortable and breathable but as some other reviews stated, keep the tops dry because the fabric doesn't remain water repellant for very long.
customer_reviews.author: TechBrat

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but poor quality.  See pics.  No customer support.
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking shoe. Good fit, breathable. Questionable quality, see photos. I wore these in an office setting and did not wear them for hiking to keep them nice. Had the blowout in the pic that I noticed halfway through my work day. Went through Amazon to get to Keen. They emailed me that they got the message and it would take two weeks for response. They never got back to me after extended amount of time. Would love to have a new pair because these are great boots, but she’s should have held up for the brief amount of time I had them.
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: my wide feet love them
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this boot. Its nice and wide and super comfy. Only issue i have had is that the glue they use for the soles isn't the best so I love had to glue them myself when they start to come apart.....however I still love these boots!! Fantastic comfort.....if i hadn't melted my last pair over the fire on a winter backpacking trio I wouldn't have had to buy a second pair....whoops.
customer_reviews.author: Duncanhouse

customer_reviews.title: I would like to find a replacement for these shoes but I ...
customer_reviews.text: This is probably my 20th pair of these. I have seen a steady decline in quality with regard to durability. With the first pairs of these that I had the first thing to wear out would be the soles after about a year of hard use. I would just wear them until the sole was gone and get another pair. I expect the soles on these new ones to come unglued at the corners and require aquaseal to repair within a couple of months and continuous maintenance after that. I would like to find a replacement for these shoes but I have not yet. The fit and comfort are superb though.
customer_reviews.author: miguelito

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the Keen hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: I find Keen shoes to be of quality and fit very well. The last set of boots that I purchased recently, found some of the stitching to be sketchy. I have not returned them yet but probably will do so shortly. Since I do a lot of hiking, the boots hold up very well in general
customer_reviews.author: Robert Ide

customer_reviews.title: Durable with great comfort and support
customer_reviews.text: I love this shoe, it's not the prettiest thing in the world, but it has amazing comfort, traction and support. I wore these the first time for a 12 mile hike in the Smoky Mountains National Park without any blisters or discomfort. They've been battered for awhile now and are still holding up perfectly so they're very durable.
customer_reviews.author: MG2506

customer_reviews.title: Order a half size up if your feet run a bit big.
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes they fit great right out of the box! Easy to put on & take off unlike my Keen utility work boots. They are the most comfortable shoes I own,Zappos recommends ordering a half size up,glad I did when ordering from Amazon. They stay tied and the laces are a good length,great for day hikes & walking. These are my everyday shoes I wish Keen offered Gortex,but they still keep my feet dry no problem.
customer_reviews.author: J.WILLIAMS

customer_reviews.title: The shoes not so good- Keen customer service PHENOMENAL!!
customer_reviews.text: The shoes themselves did not last long at all, **BUT** we contacted Keen (as some of the others did) and they were absolutely AMAZING! They asked for a picture of the failure and of the receipt (we sent a screenshot of our Amazon order page) they promptly issued us a $135 credit towards any shoes on their website. My husband decided to try the American made ones and so far they seem really nice.
customer_reviews.author: Poodle Mom

customer_reviews.title: poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: received these boots on thursday. fit great and very comfortable. was lacing them up on sunday morning the 3rd day and an eyelet strap broke, it wasn't even a end eyelet but a middle one. quality on products from China continue to be a problem, i am not sure the Chinese know what quality control is. for the price paid quality should be better, but the exchange process is easy. we will see how the new pair hold up. i only rated 2 stars due to the eyelet problem. everything else about the boot is fine
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Was told Keen boots come on the wider side that is why people like the fit
customer_reviews.text: I just bought these boots but I test fitted them at REI because I have wide feet and one is 10 1/2 and the other is 11. When test fitted I told I would be hiking in the desert foot hills to the mountains in AZ and heavy very firm boots wont mold over the rocks. Was told Keen boots come on the wider side that is why people like the fit. The sales person also said that this boot is a mid size in stiffness. Well I just wore them for a day, climbed no hills, just lite hiking to break in. No break in needed. They feel like old friends. Will give a review in a few months.
customer_reviews.author: John Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Great fit for me.
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first pair 3 years ago to backpack a portion of the Appalachian Trail. They had a very comfortable, supportive fit. I liked them so much I recently bought a second pair. I did find one drawback though. The rubber sole began to delaminate at the arch on both boots. I'm pretty sure the delamination was caused by going up and down ladders since I wore them at work for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Carriage

customer_reviews.title: Second pair
customer_reviews.text: I have a narrow foot and have typically gravitated towards narrow width light boots. Surprised at how well these feel especially after a long hike. Hike mostly in the Rocky Mountains and have backpacked with these as well. Probably my only advise would be to go 1/2 size larger if you have a somewhat narrow width. Leave more room for your toes. They are water proof and become very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great comfort - poor construction
customer_reviews.text: While this boot is the most comfortable I've ever worn I have to give it the lowest rating possible. Since I received them I had parts of the sole coming loose. After a year I have almost complete sole separation. I've tried all kinds of adhesives but nothing keeps the sole and the boot together. At this point they are not viable or safe to be worn. The lugs on the soles catch on everything. Unless under the first year warranty, Keen will not stand behind their product. For this price I expect better from Keen.
customer_reviews.author: lpatten

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: These shoes were very comfortable and very durable. Unfortunately the quality of the build has gone down drastically because the last two I have owned have been failing at the same seams in less than a year. I have been wearing keens for the last ten years but they have chosen to ignore customer satisfaction and quality for higher profit margins.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: I purchased these for the a section hike of the ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for the a section hike of the AT in Vermont. Almost immediately the soles started coming away from the shoe. You can tell that the shoe is designed well but there are quality control issues. They probably got a cheaper price at a different factory. I bought some glue and fixed them...but I hiked about 150 miles with a sole hanging off my right foot. I'm too laze to do an exchange..hopefully they aren't counting on that.
customer_reviews.author: Turnkey895

customer_reviews.title: I'm disappointed.....
customer_reviews.text: They fit as expected, very comfortable for long hikes, waterproof works great, once you break them in after a few weeks, they are like slippers. Update: They are extremely comfortable.... BUT... they aren't waterproof anymore, found out the hard way with wet feet around the toe box area. Also, the soles are very soft and don't last long at all, I need a new pair already. Sadly, not keen this time. I need something that will hold up and keep my feet dry. Sorry, Keen.
customer_reviews.author: Sagerods

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT for wider than average feet!
customer_reviews.text: It has been a long time since I've owned a pair of hiking boots. I had forgotten the need to work out the stiffness inherent in any new boot. But being a person with slightly wider than average feet, these have the foot bed recommended to me that is so important to a person with wide feet. These needed to be ordered a half size larger than you wear, but that was fairly clearly explained at the time of ordering. I am glad I saw it though. They would not be as comfortable if I had ordered my actual size! All in all, excellent boot and worth the money. I am enjoying breaking them in!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Copple

customer_reviews.title: Keens, not as good as they use to be.
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy Keen Targee 2 boots. The souls of this model will seperate. I have had about 10 pairs of this model and the they have always had the same soul problem.The last pair lasted 3 months. I have tried 5 different other models of Keen boots and returned 3 of the boot pairs because of discomfort. Very disappointed in Keen.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: I was told that this brand gives a little extra ...
customer_reviews.text: I was told that this brand gives a little extra room in the toe area. That is just what I needed. I wore these every day while vacationing in Alaska. They went from snow to rain, hiking to fishing, and stayed comfy enough to wear in the plane. I will stick with this brand from here on out.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Ciardiello

customer_reviews.title: Holding up good.  NOT WATER PROOF NOT AT ALL
customer_reviews.text: Nice pair of boots I only have about 10 miles of hiking on them so far. But holding up very nice. I will update after the summer hiking trips and tell you how they are then. I have about 50 miles on this boots. Today I went on a hike early morning. With dew in the grass I was hiking through and I can tell you from a fact. THIS BOOTS ARE NOT EVEN CLOSE TO BEING WATER PROOF OR EVER WATER RESISTANT. MY FEET WERE ALL WET after a 6 mile hike.
customer_reviews.author: Us

customer_reviews.title: Keen quality no longer worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed in Keen's. For years they have been my husband's favorite shoe for work. Comfortable, waterproof, supportive. We usually buy him a new pair once a year. The last pair we bought for work only lasted 5 months before the sole started separating from the shoe but we assumed it was a fluke and ordered these ones. After 4 days (yes 4 days) the sole separated on both shoes. I'm not sure what has changed in the production of their shoes but sadly their quality is no longer worth their price. We returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Murray

customer_reviews.title: Fit so well you don't even have to break them in!
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots! They are very durable and comfortable. This is my 4th or fifth pair because I wear them everyday. I have the short one that I wear most days and the "Mids" that I wear when hiking or backpacking or serious work. They are waterproof and fit my foot very well. They fit so well that I don't even have to break them in before a serious hike. I usually wear a size 10.5 or 11 but these need to be an 11.5 to fit right.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hyer

customer_reviews.title: Keen Targhee - great performing work/hiking boots!
customer_reviews.text: I have a landscape company and I’ve been wearing keen waterproof hiking boots for work for five years now. These boots seem to have the best tread of any I have tried. I replace the Keen insoles with Dr Scholls work boot insoles. I have yet to find a pair of boots that manufacture a good insole as a standard issue. I always replace the insoles for something with more cushion. I put anywhere from 5 to 12 miles of walking on these boots every day. I’m very happy with them. They perform very well! I already ordered my next pair as I go through 2-3 pairs per year.
customer_reviews.author: Chris P Peppers

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 1/2 size larger as stated and they fit great. These are the most comfortable boots I have ever bought. They look good too. I have had several people comment on them. The weather has been a little less than perfect so I have been wearing them to work. I work at a desk in a hospital setting and I do a lot of walking. I'm going to buy another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for people with wide feet.
customer_reviews.text: Avid backpacker who has tried many boots. Always return to Keens. Most trail boots are just to narrow for my feet. Pain and discomfort after long trek. No a problem for my Keens. Love the wide toes box and toe guard. Some manufacturers boots are waterproof for a few months. Keens stay waterproof for years. Now on my sixth pair in twelve years. Never leaving Keene again
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Messina

customer_reviews.title: KEENS are the best
customer_reviews.text: You can’t go wrong with KEEN shoes. They are top notch. I probably should have went a half size larger for these boots due to thicker socks but they are still more comfortable then several hiking boots I’ve had in the past. Highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for some back country hiking. I have about 20 miles on them and the soles are coming apart. I did a small repair myself last week and today I see 2 more spots coming apart. I'm going to make an attempt to return them but I don't have much hope of that.
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Was deceived by point of origin
customer_reviews.text: The information provided states the product is made in the USA or imported. I purchased the shoes thinking they were made in the USA. They were imported. I don't buy imported products if I have a choice. I doubt there was ever a pair of these shoes made in the USA. I will be very careful believing information provided by Keen in the future. I purchased Merrell products in the past, but they were made in china so I tried Keen. Didn't do much better than china.
customer_reviews.author: Richard R.

customer_reviews.title: Not quite right for me personally
customer_reviews.text: Toe box is very comfortable. Enough room for all my toes! The padding on the bottom however didn't quite match up with my feet and felt uncomfortable. I returned for something else. Seems like a nice boot, but it's all about fit for the individual. So, for ME, these didn't quite work. As for fit, I order 1/2 up and they felt good with my lightweight wool socks. If you're wearing bulky, heavy duty wool socks, you'll want to take that into consideration.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much what you would expect from Keen
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for couple of months now. They are holding up just fine so far. Their weight is lighter than I expected, which is a good thing of course. Comfortable fit. Waterproof. My feet were a bit cold in 15F winter weather, but these are not exactly winter boots, so I can't complain about that.
customer_reviews.author: Vladimir Nemirovsky

customer_reviews.title: Ahhhhh my feet are so happy. Very happy.
customer_reviews.text: These were highly recommended by a friend and so far they are living up to expectations. Very comfortable and not to heavy for every day use. Based on user feedback I ordered 2 pairs, one my regular shoe size and one slightly larger, my regular size fitted perfectly. Will update later. Update: The thread on the right heel is peeling off, what gives , bad glue or qc, hence the drop to 2 stars not quite a year but I was expecting a little longer life span, hence the drop to 2 stars😂 from 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: DëV

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Keens have gone downhill. Used to be my go to hiking shoe/boot. Their products have suffered tremendously in recent years and the quality has gone downhill. So sad to say, but true. Suggestion: Look to other brands like Oboz instead...
customer_reviews.author: dbkr

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I saw the comment that the boot runs small so I ordered 1 size up. I wear a 10. I ordered a 10.5. This boot fit me perfectly. I have high arches and my feet feel very comfortable and supported in these boots. Ive never owned a pair of Keen boots before but so far im a fan!
customer_reviews.author: rita

customer_reviews.title: perfect for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: These shoes have excellent traction, are breathable, and include shank support for backpacking... I use them alot and they are still in great shape all the way 'round and inside too. Keen really does hold up to many shoes that cost more. I would buy again, but i probably won't need to for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: rcb

customer_reviews.title: Terrible wet traction, poor quality, very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: After 5 years of use, my beloved Keens were starting to wear out. Naturally I wanted to replace them with a similar pair of new Keens. First impressions were great. The new Keens were very comfortable and looked nice. Then it rained. These new Keens were absolutely awful on wet rocks compared to my old pair of Keens. The dry traction is fine but I use my Keens in wet slippery conditions all the time and the wet traction is terrible. Even worse, after about 5 months of medium duty use, the sole is starting to fall apart. My next pair of boots will certainly not be Keens, VERY disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Keens - love em or hate em.
customer_reviews.text: This is like my 10th pair of Keens and the 3rd Targhee mid boots. I like the arch support (just right for my flat feet) and the wide toe box. This year all the Keen sizes seemed to go up by 1/2 - I used to be just right in a 12 but now the 11.5 is the best fit. It looks like the redesigned the rubber sole so maybe it won't keep delaminating like the last 9 pairs. One beef - there is extra material (waterproof liner?) bunched at the top of my toes - it's kind of irritating - I don't know if it will wear in.
customer_reviews.author: TW

customer_reviews.title: they fit comfortably the very first day
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing these all day long nearly every day since I bought them. Virtually no break in period, they fit comfortably the very first day. Update: I’ve now had these shoes for over two years and they’re STILL my favorite hiking boots. However, the adhesive they used to attach the tread is laughably bad. The tread started coming off and flopping around within a few months of purchase, I highly recommend purchasing a tube of ‘Shoe Goo’ at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Schmidtke

customer_reviews.title: Seem to be a really great hiking boot
customer_reviews.text: Very light considering how durable they feel. I bought these to go hiking in the Ozarks for a family vacation. I put them through the paces on rocky terrain and completely submerged them when crossing a river. They were dry the next morning and were back to normal after only a few steps. Seem to be a really great hiking boot. I have even been wearing them to work because they are more comfortable than my work boots.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth M. Fagan

customer_reviews.title: Seems to run small due to upturned toe guard
customer_reviews.text: I don’t understand Keens. I love the price and look of these boots. However, I ordered my usual size of 10.5 and my toes hit the rubber toe guard. So I ordered a size 11 and had the same issue!!! I think Keens slightly upturns the end of their shoes and boots. It seems like this can cause them to feel shorter and tighter fitting. Unfortunately, I will not be able to wear either pair because my feet feel like hamburger at the end of a hike. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Flexible Sturdy Perfection
customer_reviews.text: Best hiking shoes ever! These replaced my old Keens that I wore for 5 years until finally the sole tread was completely worn out. Well made. Super supportive for ankle stability. Very flexible -- not stiff but yet sturdy where you want it to be. I jog in them on street because they are so light and comfortable and have thick cushioned sole and also they are rugged enough to jog on wooded trails. And waterproof so I can jog in the mud.
customer_reviews.author: jenn

customer_reviews.title: Wow, what a disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Within the first week of wearing the boots, the stitching gave way near the toe box were the mesh material meets the leather. I expected way more out of Keen.
customer_reviews.author: CH

customer_reviews.title: Keen's are awesome
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so maybe I am a little biased since this is my 3rd pair of the same shoes over the last several years, but I love these shoes. They run a little snug, but that is the way I like them. They are very durable, I put them through a lot, but they perform great every time. I bought this pair as a replacement for the previous pair because I had worn through the bottom of the soles and they were starting to look shabby, but that was after a few years of service and lots of miles on them, I will still keep them for yard shoes. Buy them, you will love them.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Shap

customer_reviews.title: The toe box was meant to fit the toes and not the eyes,
customer_reviews.text: These are my sixth pair they fit my feet. They last long and take a beating. They look like boots should. I can ride a bike get out in the dirt and stop at Starbucks.
customer_reviews.author: G Hanes

customer_reviews.title: KEEN - BUYER BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: For the price of Keen Shoes, buy disposable shoes at Walmart. My pair of Targee literally fell apart. Keen provides a warranty credit - which had to be used to purchase more Keen shoes. $160 shoes WP Built in America - soaked feet 6 months later in wet grass. Keen's stance - sorry for your loss
customer_reviews.author: Dale Riley

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy. They fall apart in 3 months. Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I've had these shoes since Oct. 8th 2018, today is 1/29/19. I use the shoes as my daily shoes. They are seriously falling apart already... The black parts of the bottoms are literally coming unglued and coming off. The seem around the edges of the shoes where the leather meets the rubber has already separated also.. No longer waterproof at this point.. very disappointed.. I'm sticking with Merrill next time
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable durable shoes
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair and my first pair isn't even worn out after 2 years. These Keen shoes have been way more durable than the Merrill's I've had in the past. I used to only where Merrills for years but their quality went downhill so I switched to Keen and have been very pleased. They look kinda funny with the bulbous rubber toe but they've held together well and are very comfortable. I don't foresee any problems with this new pair.
customer_reviews.author: AKrider

customer_reviews.title: ) I am amazed by the quality and comfort of these shoes and ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of these. I get about five years out of them. Don't know why others get less? I wear mine every day and everywhere! Never worn a pair out, just get kind of smelly after a few years on my old smelly feet and I replace them which I can't complain about that can I:) I am amazed by the quality and comfort of these shoes and they have never needed broken in either. I have bone spurs in both feet which cause a lot of pain but these shoes give enough natural support that I don't need my orthotics like I do in other brands. Great choice for older hikers and gardeners!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Love these......
customer_reviews.text: These Keen Targhee's fit and look great with plenty of detail. Just received couple of days ago so can't attest for their durability but appear to be robustly constructed. They are made just a bit wide in the toe box but fit my wider foot just perfect on the sides; no cramping like another very popular hiking boot. These also have quite a bit of reflective stripping (I like) so will be effective for others to see you especially if you take walks at night. May not be the best for tactical uses (at night) since your position may be more easily discovered. Nice shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Q.

product_meta.title: KEEN Men's 1002375 Hiking Boot, Black Olive/Yellow, 6.5 UK
product_meta.description: Four-wheel-drive performance for your feet. This waterproof hiking boot keeps your feet dry and lets them breathe, and the aggressive outsole bites into the terrain. It's built for all-day comfort, and the mid-cut height adds ankle support. Weighing 17.4 oz / 493.3 g (per boot), made with durable, waterproof and salt-resistant leather and featuring a moisture-wicking lining, the Targhee 2 Waterproof Hiking Boot is built off KEEN's traditional wider footwear form. KEEN products are consciously created using a natural, pesticide-free probiotic-based technology called Eco Anti-Odor for breaking down odor in sweat, PFC-free water repellent (in applicable styles) and leather sourced from Leather Working Group (LWG)-certified tanneries. KEEN makes shoes to make a difference. From the products it makes, to the actions the it takes, KEEN inspires people to live and work monumental every day. As a brand born for life outside, KEEN has a responsibility to protect and conserve the places where all people live, play and work.
feature_bullets: WATERPROOF: The KEEN.DRY waterproof, breathable membrane keeps your feet dry and comfortable all day long by allowing vapor out without letting water in; All leather is treated with a PFC-free water repellant, so you still get the same protection without the harmful chemicals

TRACTION  & SUPPORT: KEEN ALL-TERRAIN rubber outsole provides high-traction grip in all environments; Non-marking rubber outsoles leaves no trace when walking indoors; The Torsion stability External Support Shank (ESS) and mid-cut height adds ankle support and balance; the contoured heel provides a next-level stability

SUPPORT: The Torsion stability External Support Shank (ESS) and mid-cut height adds ankle support and balance on uneven surfaces; Low-profile upper for secure fit with padded tongue and collar; the contoured heel provides a next-level stability

FIT & COMFORT: Low-profile upper for comfort and secure fit with padded tongue and collar; The Metatomical Footbed Design provides excellent arch support and cradles to the natural contours of the foot; This style is running a 1/2 size small; We suggest ordering a 1/2 size larger than your usual size

CARE TIPS: We've carefully selected leather uppers designed to last; However, if you're wearing your KEENs daily, they won't always be scuff and dirt-free; To treat day to day wear and tear we recommend using a common leather cleaner and conditioner
